name: D&D Monster Sheet
description: Develop your monster based on the Dungeons & Dragons tabletop role-playing game

attributes.name: Type
attributes.description: The monster's Type, or species, influences their appearance and traits (e.g. Beast, Dragon, Giant)

attributes.name: Alignment
attributes.description: A representation of the monster's ethical and moral values (e.g. lawful good, neutral, chaotic evil)

attributes.name: Armor Class
attributes.description: A score representing how difficult the monster is to successfully attack

attributes.name: Hit Points
attributes.description: A score representing the's monster's current health

attributes.name: Speed
attributes.description: A score representing the monster's raw speed, which is influenced by their Type

attributes.name: Strength
attributes.description: On a scale of 1-30, a score representing skill in physical combat, carrying objects, and breaking physical barriers

attributes.name: Dexterity
attributes.description: On a scale of 1-30, a score representing skill in dodging attacks, avoiding traps, and hiding from enemies

attributes.name: Constitution
attributes.description: On a scale of 1-30, a score representing health, endurance, and general survival ability

attributes.name: Intelligence
attributes.description: On a scale of 1-30, a score representing knowledge, cleverness, and logical reasoning skills

attributes.name: Wisdom
attributes.description: On a scale of 1-30, a score representing awareness, intuition, and ability to spot hidden traps and foes

attributes.name: Charisma
attributes.description: On a scale of 1-30, a score representing skill in social situations, likability, and general persuasiveness

attributes.name: Saving Throws
attributes.description: A score representing the character's ability to resist or prevent a threat

attributes.name: Skills
attributes.description: The ability score of each character skill (e.g. acrobatics, arcana, medicine, religion, survival)

attributes.name: Damage Vulnerabilities
attributes.description: The damage types that cause double damage (e.g. acid, fire, poison)

attributes.name: Damage Resistances
attributes.description: The damage types that only cause the monster half damage (e.g. bludgeoning, force, lightning)

attributes.name: Damage Immunities
attributes.description: The damage types that cause the monster no damage (e.g. psychic, slashing, thunder)

attributes.name: Condition Immunities
attributes.description: The conditions that cause the monster no adverse effects (e.g. blinded, paralyzed, stunned)

attributes.name: Senses
attributes.description: The monster's Passive Wisdom (Perception) score, and any special senses they have (e.g. Truesight)

attributes.name: Languages
attributes.description: The languages the monster can speak or understand

attributes.name: Challenge
attributes.description: A score representing how difficult the monster is to defeat in combat and the experience points (XP) it awards

attributes.name: Actions
attributes.description: The actions the monster can take in combat

attributes.name: Reactions
attributes.description: The monster's special reactions in combat, if any

attributes.name: Legendary Actions
attributes.description: Special actions the monster can take outside its turn (applies to legendary creatures only)

attributes.name: Size
attributes.description: The monster's Size determines how much space it occupies in combat (e.g. Tiny, Medium, Huge)

attributes.name: Special Traits
attributes.description: Special characteristics and/or abilities that may influence the monster's skill in combat

attributes.name: Equipment
attributes.description: The monster's inventory of gear, gems, jewelry, magic items, and other objects of value (e.g. rope)
